help.info: Test if a point is contained inside the union of polyhedra in the same dimension.
help.descr: Check if the point x0 is contained in one of the polyhedra stored in the union U. The result it the logical statement if x \in U and false otherwise. If the point is contained inside the union, index of the corresponding polyhedra in which the point lie is returned. If the point does not lie in the union, the index of the region with the least distance to the point x is returned.

input.name: U
input.descr: PolyUnion object that holds sets polyhedra in the same dimension.

input.name: x
input.descr: A point in the same dimension as the union.

input.name: fastbreak
input.descr: Do a quick stop in the consecutive search when x is contained in the first polyhedron it founds.

output.name: isin
output.descr: True if x \in U and false otherwise.

output.name: inwhich
output.descr: The index set that indicates in which polyhedra of the union the point x lies.

output.name: closest
output.descr: If the point is not contained inside the union, this output indicates the index of the polyhedron that has the least distance to the point x.

example.descr: Create an union of these sets without specifying any properties.
Check if the point x=(1,-1,0) is contained in the union.
